Package controller

Class MovieController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.MovieController
  • public class MovieController
extends java.lang.Object
    A control class that will handle methods relating to the movie model. It allows for the creation, search and editing of movie objects.
    Since:
    2019-11-13
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Lim Wai Leong, Oh Jun Teng, Edhie Wahidin Michelle, Myat Hmu Khin
    See Also:
    Movie

      • movieArr

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Movie> movieArr

    • Constructor Detail

      • MovieController

        public MovieController()

    • Method Detail

      • createMovie

        public static void createMovie​(java.lang.String name,
                               java.lang.String showingStatus,
                               java.lang.String synopsis,
                               java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> cast,
                               java.lang.String director,
                               java.lang.String type,
                               java.lang.String movieRating)
        Creates a Movie object. Adds the newly created object to movieArr. Adds the movie with all relevent details into moviedatabase.
        Parameters:
        name - Movie title
        showingStatus - Status can be Coming Soon, Preview, Now Showing, End Of Showing
        synopsis - Synopsis of movie
        cast - Cast of movie
        director - Director of movie
        type - Genre of movie. Eg. Action, adventure, etc.
        movieRating - Rating of move. Eg. PG13, PG, etc

      • editMovieStringDetails

        public static void editMovieStringDetails​(int selection,
                                          java.lang.String moviename,
                                          java.lang.String change)
        Edits movie details (title, type, showing status, synopsis, rating, director, cast list) in the moviedatabase. Uses selection to determine what attribute to alter.
        Parameters:
        selection - Selection of what to edit
        moviename - Name of movie to edit
        change - The change to be implemented.

      • searchMovies

        public static java.lang.String[] searchMovies()
        Returns names of all movies that exist in database.
        Returns:
        String array of movie names

      • movieExists

        public static boolean movieExists​(java.lang.String title)
        Checks that movie exists in moviedatabase when given title of movie.
        Parameters:
        title - Title of movie.
        Returns:
        boolean value true if exists, false if not.

      • showTopMovies

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> showTopMovies​(int selection)
        Depending on selection, returns top 5 movies.
        Parameters:
        selection - Selection of which sort to return.
        Returns:
        If selection == 1, returns sorted by overall rating. If selection == 2, returns sorted by total sales.

      • searchOneMovie

        public static int searchOneMovie​(java.lang.String name)
        Searches for matching movieID given movie title.
        Parameters:
        name - Movie title of target movie
        Returns:
        movieID that matches target movie if target found. Else, returns -1.

      • searchMovieDetails

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> searchMovieDetails​(int movieID)
        Searches and returns all details of target movie. Will print No reviews has been written about this movie yet. if no reviews can be found.
        Otherwise will be in sequence of Name, Movie Type, Showing Status, Synopsis, Director, Cast, Overall Rating, Movie Age Rating, Comment, and User's Rating
        Will call searchforReview.
        Parameters:
        movieID - Unique movieID of target movie
        Returns:
        All details of a target movie stored in a ArrayList<String>.
        See Also:
        ReviewController.searchforReview(int)
